title: RS20139
content: After many years of difficult negotiations, China, on December 11, 2001, become amember of the World TradeOrganization (WTO), the international agency that administers multilateral trade rules. Under the terms of its WTOmembership, China agreed to significantlyliberalize its trade and investment regimes. A main concern for Congress is to ensure that China fully complies withits WTO commitments. According to U.S.government officials and many business representatives, China's WTO compliance record has been mixed.. Thisreport will be updated as events warrant.
